alert.note: Alert for Anchorage (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 06 at 5:12AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...SNOW MAY IMPACT THE MONDAY EVENING COMMUTE ACROSS THE ANCHORAGE BOWL... Snow is expected to develop across the Anchorage Bowl Monday morning in response to an area of low pressure moving north from the Kenai Peninsula. Any snow this morning is expected to be light in intensity and fall mainly after the Monday morning commute. Snowfall rates are expected to increase by late Monday morning or early Monday afternoon, with the potential for a period of moderate to heavy snow just in time for the evening commute. The snow is then expected to taper off Monday evening before ending Monday night. Snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches are expected, with locally higher amounts possible across the southern half of Anchorage and along the Anchorage Hillside. Motorists are urged to slow down and use caution while traveling. There is still uncertainty regarding the exact timing of any heavier snowfall. Please visit www.weather.gov/afc for updates to the forecast. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
